metadata.Title: CVE-2022-45421 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers Andrew McCreight and Gabriele Svelto reported memorysafety bugs present in Thunderbird 102.4. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort someof these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.5, Thunderbird < 102.5, and Firefox< 107.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45421` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
